title: 8-Bit Storage Function Block
description: This function block enables the storage of up to 8 boolean values based on external inputs. It initializes and controls the storage of these values based on set, reset, and clear conditions.
name: STORE_8

input.name: Set
input.description: A signal to enable setting the storage values.

input.name: D0
input.description: Input for the first bit in the storage.

input.name: D1
input.description: Input for the second bit in the storage.

input.name: D2
input.description: Input for the third bit in the storage.

input.name: D3
input.description: Input for the fourth bit in the storage.

input.name: D4
input.description: Input for the fifth bit in the storage.

input.name: D5
input.description: Input for the sixth bit in the storage.

input.name: D6
input.description: Input for the seventh bit in the storage.

input.name: D7
input.description: Input for the eighth bit in the storage.

input.name: Clr
input.description: A signal to clear the stored values.

input.name: Rst
input.description: A signal to reset the storage values.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output for the first stored bit.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output for the second stored bit.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output for the third stored bit.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output for the fourth stored bit.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Output for the fifth stored bit.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Output for the sixth stored bit.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Output for the seventh stored bit.

output.name: Q7
output.description: Output for the eighth stored bit.
